description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are to modernize and increase the productivity of Vietnamese agriculture, improve the management of water resources and reduce dam safety risks through: (i) the modernization of irrigation services in selected irrigation schemes within the Project Provinces; (ii) the improvement of dam safety and management; and (iii) the integrated development and management of the Thu Bon River Basin in Quang Nam Province.

condition.narrative: MOU Between MOF and Project Provinces regarding Project Financing
Prepare EMPs for Each Sub-Project Province
Prepare Tender Documents for Dam Safety Works
Prepare Time-Bound Action Plan for National Dam Safety Coordination Mechanism

comment.narrative: No WUG at the project start-up stage
66 WUGs established and functioning
66 WUGs were established by the project

title.narrative: Water user groups covering 25% of each scheme area with volumetric contracts.

comment.narrative: No water user group established at the project appraisal

target.value: Volumetric contracts formulated by year 4, implemented in pilot areas by year 5, and implemented in 25% of each scheme by year 7.

comment.narrative: Volumetric contract is replaced by service contract as no measuring device installed in any off-take of tertiary/on-farm canals.
66 water user groups have been established in 6 irrigation schemes under the project. These 66 WUGs cover 20% of the total projectcommand area.

title.narrative: IMC collection area of each scheme increases to 75% of the design command area in peak irrigation season.

baseline.value: 20% to 61% of the design command areas are serviced by the current irrigation systems.

comment.narrative: an indicator of collection area to reach 75% of the design command area by the project completion has changed into contracted areaversus design command area. This change was resulted by the Government decision to abolish the irrigation fee in 2009.

target.value: 75% of the design command area served by the improved schemes.

actual.value: about 83% of the sign command area served by the improved schemes financed by the project

comment.narrative: The actual ratio between contracted area versus design command area is at 83% which is higher than the 75% target ratio of theproject.

title.narrative: Operational water user associations created and/or strengthened (number)

comment.narrative: no WUA available at the project start up stage
Three WUAs are established and functioning at secondary canal level.
Establishment of three pilot Water Users Associations (WUAs) in three subprojects to manage canal at secondary level.

title.narrative: Irrigation Performance of 6 major irrigation systems has been improved.

baseline.value: Baseline of irrigation performance was established in 6 major irrigation systems in 2007.

comment.narrative: the Project needs to rearrange these baselines for evaluation at the completion of the project
An irrigation modernization manual is finalized and adopted by MARD at the end of the project.

actual.value: Rehabiliation and modernization works have partially been completed in all 6 irrigation schemes included under the project. Someremaining works were not carried out due to shortage of available funds under the project. A guidelines on irrigation benchmarkinghasbeen prepared and applied in all schemes at the end of the project.

comment.narrative: Civil works and goods on irrigation rehabilitation and modernization have been completed with good results. An irrigationmodernization manual has been prepared and adopted by MARD for future use.

title.narrative: Six dams in Component 1 and at least 4 other MARD's owned dams have acceptable audits by MARD Dam Safety Unit.

target.value: All 6 dams under component 1 and other 4 MARD's dams under component 2 are fully improved their safety condition and audited by DSU.

actual.value: Dam safety works for all 10 dams are fully completed.

comment.narrative: All works on dam safety have been completed with good results.

title.narrative: Restoration of river flows to Da Nang City.

baseline.value: The historical minimum flow of Vu Gia River flowing to Da Nang City.

target.value: The minimum flow of Vu Gia River will meet the water demand of Da Nang City.

actual.value: Restoration works was completed in 2009. The minimum flow of the Vu Gia-Thu Bon is now reported meeting the water demand of DaNangcity.

comment.narrative: the work was completed in 2009.

title.narrative: Improved dam safety imstrumentation for Hoa Binh reservoir.

baseline.value: baseline data on Hoa Binh dam safety instrumentation was carried out byElectricity of Vietnam (EVN) during the project preparationphase.

target.value: New dam safety instruments installed by end 2011.

actual.value: Dam safety instruments have been installed and certified completed.

comment.narrative: Works already completed

target.value: Established by year 3, biannual report-1 by year 5, and bi-annual report-2 by year 7.

actual.value: A basin coordination committee has been established in 2007

comment.narrative: IDA discussed with GoV agencies a proposal to delegate MARD to be responsible for preparation of feasibility studies for prioritybasin investments. The amendment of DCA has been approved by the GoV and confirmed by IDA.

title.narrative: Two feasibility studies for water resources infrastructure in Thu Bon River basin.

target.value: Feasibility studies underway by year 5, FSs approved and finance sources identifies by year 7.

comment.narrative: Two feasibility studies shall be approved by MARD at the project completion

actual.value: Two feasibility studies of the VU Gia-Thu Bon river master plan have been prepared and approved by the city authority of Danang.

comment.narrative: Two feasibility studies have been prepared and approved.

title.narrative: MARD Dam Safety Unit will reduce the number of dams at risk.

baseline.value: The baseline was established following the dam safety survey.

target.value: Reduction of some 10 major dams at risk by the project completion.

comment.narrative: A dam safety guidelines is being finalized and adopted by MARD at the project closing.
Safety works in 10 dams under the project fully completed with high quality. A guidelines on dam safety has been prepared andadopted by MARD for use in the future.
